- If we reach a later stage and **we still have not received any [APPLY] from higher-priority candidates**, we will reassess whether to extend an offer to remaining interested students.
- Your continued interest is noted; if School_B remains open later, submitting a fresh **[APPLY]** at that time is the right way to be considered immediately.

The student asks for information about who is unmatched; however, School_B does not have verifiable, official visibility into other schools’ current matches beyond what is revealed through applications received. Providing speculative or incorrect status could harm strategy. Best response: explain we cannot confirm others’ match status, reiterate policy (hold seat for higher-priority applicants while they could still apply), and instruct Student_E to continue monitoring and apply again later if still open.

conversation.message:
Dear School_B Admissions Committee,

I’m Student_E, and I’m submitting a fresh formal [APPLY] in Round 12.

School_B remains my top remaining choice, and if offered admission I will accept immediately and commit to enrolling.

Given that we are now in Round 12 and your seat is still unfilled, if you have not received any [APPLY] from higher-priority candidates, I respectfully ask that you consider finalizing the match with me now so the seat does not remain vacant.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: Only School_B remains unmatched and it is my #2 true choice (and top remaining option). Re-applying keeps me eligible if School_B decides to stop holding the seat for higher-priority students; a [TALK] would likely just repeat prior guidance. I will submit a concise, commitment-forward application and ask them to finalize if no higher-priority applicants have appeared by now.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your Round 12 application and for your continued commitment to enrolling if admitted.

At this time, we are not able to offer you admission. With one seat available, we must continue to reserve capacity for applicants who are higher on our priority list should they apply in upcoming rounds.

We appreciate your persistence and interest in School_B, and we wish you the best as the process continues.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_E is last on School_B’s true priority list. Higher-priority students (D, A, B, C) could still apply in future rounds; in particular, Student_D ranks School_B 3rd and could reach us if rejected by School_C and School_A, and Student_A ranks School_B 4th and could also fall back later. We have quota 1 and are currently unmatched, but accepting E now would block any later higher-priority applicant, which conflicts with the objective to match as high as possible on our priority list. Given the history, E is persistent, but priority-based strategy still favors holding the seat. Therefore reject again.

conversation.message:

School_B remains my top remaining choice, and if offered admission I will accept immediately and commit to enrolling.

I understand you have been reserving the seat in case a higher-priority student applies. If you do not receive an [APPLY] from any higher-priority candidate this round, I respectfully ask that you consider finalizing the open seat with me so the position does not remain unfilled.

Thank you again for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,

conversation.thought: Only School_B remains unmatched and it is my #2 true preference. Prior attempts were rejected because they are holding the seat for higher-priority students. The best move is to submit a fresh formal application again, emphasizing immediate commitment and proposing a practical condition: if no higher-priority applicants apply this round, finalize with me to avoid the seat staying vacant.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your continued interest in School_B and for your Round 13 application.

Given the stage of the process and the fact that we have not received applications from higher-priority candidates, we are prepared to finalize our remaining seat with a student who is ready to commit.

We are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. If you accept, this will complete the match.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: School_B true priority ranks Student_E last. However, by Round 13 we have repeatedly received only Student_E applications; no higher-priority students (D/A/B/C) have applied to School_B. Given students' preferences: D ranks B 3rd, A ranks B 4th, B ranks B 1st (but we already rejected; B may be matched elsewhere), C ranks B 3rd. It is increasingly unlikely a higher-priority student will apply this late, and leaving the seat empty is worse than matching with an included student (E is included). To maximize chance of filling quota with best available, accept Student_E now.
